sentences.en: But most choose to slog unhappily on with their sham and desolate unions.
sentences.cn: 但是大部分还是选择继续她们伪装和不幸的婚姻.

sentences.en: But there must be no talk of final victory; rather, the long, hard slog to a solution.
sentences.cn: 但是这还谈不上是最后的胜利；而是长期、艰难地寻找解决方法的过程。

sentences.en: He’s been slogging round the streets delivering catalogues.
sentences.cn: 他奔波在街头递送商品目录。

sentences.en: I slog my guts out and get paid only a hundred pounds a week.
sentences.cn: 我工作非常努力,但每星期只有100英镑的报酬.

sentences.en: It is a long hard slog up the mountain.
sentences.cn: 上山是一段长长的艰难的路.

sentences.en: It's a long hard slog up the mountain.
Marking the exam papers was quite a slog.
sentences.cn: 评阅试卷是很辛苦的工作.

sentences.en: Mother slogged all her life for us.
sentences.cn: 妈妈为我们操劳了一辈子。

sentences.en: That is working — particularly in Romania — but it is a slow slog elsewhere.
sentences.cn: 这种方法很奏效-特别是在罗马尼亚-但是在别的地方步履艰难.

sentences.en: The men had to slog up a steep muddy incline.
sentences.cn: 人们只得在陡峭而泥泞的斜坡上艰难地行进。

sentences.en: We know that seniority, especially in finance, is a long, hard, unglamorous slog.
sentences.cn: 我们知道,晋升至高管职位 —— 尤其是在金融业 —— 是漫长 、 艰难而乏味的旅途.

words.tran_cn: 猛击者；乱打者；勤劳的工作者

trans.tran_en: to make a long hard journey somewhere, especially on foot

trans.tran_cn: 猛击，步履艰难地行，努力苦干
